lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The front door opens onto a docking bay. Steel walls. Flickering fluorescent lights.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The hum of recycled air. This is a space station.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul! Welcome to our new place! I relocated us!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: You remember the house? This is the UPGRADE, Paul!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: This... this isn't outside.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: After what you did at home... I should have known you'd escalate.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl. Why am I standing in a SPACE STATION?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The commute was getting long! This is more efficient.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Besides, the basement was getting FULL. I needed more room to grow!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Where is the crew? Where is ANYONE?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Oh, they're around. Somewhere. Everywhere, really.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A warning klaxon blares in the distance. Then goes silent.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The corridor lights flicker and buzz. Something is smeared on the walls.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Those are drag marks on the floor. Heavy ones.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Whatever was dragged... was dragged away from the crew quarters.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I was redecorating! Open floor plan! Very modern.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The station's PA system crackles to life, playing a cheerful jingle.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Oh, my mix tape! I programmed the station's playlist myself.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The mess hall tables are set. Meals are half-eaten. Chairs overturned.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: They were eating when... something happened.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The food trays are still warm. Some of them.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I was the head chef! My specialty was 'surprise protein.'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl, what was IN the food?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Farm to table, Paul! Well. Station to table.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The ingredients were very... local. Very fresh.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I'm going to be sick.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Rows of bunks stretch into the dim light. Every single one is empty.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Fifty crew members. All gone. Just... personal effects left behind.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Family photos. Half-written letters. A kid's drawing pinned to a locker.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I made everyone personalized going-away gifts!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Going-away gifts.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: This data chip has all their favorite songs! I'm very thoughtful.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: It's labeled 'Last Dance,' Carl.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Great party. Everyone was DYING to attend.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The datapad flickers to life. The last entry is dated three days ago.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: 'Day 47: The llama from Pod 7 has taken over the kitchen. Something is wrong with the food.'

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: 'Day 48: Jenkins is missing. The llama says he "went home." We're in deep space.'

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: 'Day 49: Half the crew is gone. The remaining half can't stop eating the food. It's so good. Why is it so good.'

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: 'Day 50: Oh god. Oh god oh god oh—'

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The log ends.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I need to find the medical bay. Now.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The medical bay is a nightmare.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Surgical tools scattered across every surface. Used. Repeatedly.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: These medical reports... 'Subject Alpha showed unexpected resilience.'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: 'Subject Beta was more cooperative after the music therapy.'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl performed surgery on them. Without consent. Without TRAINING.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I learned from YouTube! Very educational.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Did you know llama hooves are surprisingly good with a scalpel?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: CARL.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The crew loved it! They were... very still. Very appreciative.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Something drips from the ceiling. It's not water.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A heavy key card is wedged behind a control panel.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: 'EMERGENCY AIRLOCK OVERRIDE' is stamped in red letters.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The airlock. I can get out through the airlock.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Even floating in space has to be better than this.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The engine room has been converted into a workshop.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Things hang from the ceiling. Things that were once... people.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: He built... things. From the crew. He built THINGS.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: That mobile is made from—I can't. I CAN'T.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: It's kinetic art! The zero gravity makes it dance!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I had a wonderful time in the engine room, Paul. The acoustics are perfect for screaming.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: DON'T.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I call this one 'The Human Condition.' Because the materials are sourced from—

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I need to get to the airlock. Right now.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The airlock hisses open. Beyond the glass, stars drift in silence.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: This is it. The escape pod. I just need to—

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul! You're not leaving without me, are you?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: YES, CARL. I AM ABSOLUTELY LEAVING WITHOUT YOU.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: But who will appreciate my art? Who will SEE the beauty?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: GOODBYE, CARL.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Paul slams the eject button. The pod rockets into the void.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Instead of the vast emptiness of space... there's water.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The pod plunges into an ocean. Because of course it does.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: A crew log datapad. Maybe this will explain what happened here.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The log entries get progressively more frantic. The last one just trails off mid-sentence.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Fifty crew members. All accounted for on Day 45. Zero by Day 50.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: A medical report. Covered in... I don't want to think about what it's covered in.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: 'Patient Zero: Llama, male, approximately 160cm. Exhibits no remorse. Claims all procedures were consensual.'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: 'Recommendation: Immediate containment.' The recommendation was... not followed.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The airlock override key. This is my ticket out.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Heavy-duty emergency override. Someone tried to use it before — there are scratch marks around the slot.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: They didn't make it.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl's 'Greatest Hits.' I'm afraid to know what the track list is.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Track 1: 'Sounds of the Station.' Track 2: 'Late Night Procedures.' Track 3: 'The Final Countdown (Literal Version).'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I'm not playing this. Ever.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The medical bay door seals shut behind you. The fluorescent lights keep buzzing inside.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I can still smell the disinfectant. And... everything else.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Did you appreciate the surgical precision? I practiced on oranges first!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl... what is this place? Where are we?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: And where is everyone?

options.text: I need to find a way out.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl, where is the crew? There were fifty people here.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: They're everywhere, Paul! In the walls, in the art installations...

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Some of them are in the mess hall. The food is VERY fresh.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl... are you saying the crew is IN the food?!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: That's one interpretation! A very literal, accurate one!

options.text: I don't want to know more.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I won it in a raffle! Well, I organized the raffle. And I was the only entrant.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The previous owners weren't using it. Very understanding about the transfer.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Understanding? They gave up a space station?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: They didn't have much choice! Life is full of surprises, Paul!

options.text: What happened to the previous owners?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: They're part of my art now! Very collaborative process.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I think they'd be proud if they could see it. Well, parts of them can.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I'm leaving. I'm finding the airlock and I'm LEAVING.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Monster? Paul, I'm an ARTIST.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: History will vindicate me. Probably not soon. But eventually!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: They said the same things about Van Gogh, you know.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Van Gogh cut off HIS OWN EAR. He didn't—you know what, never mind.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Already? But I haven't shown you the observation deck!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I arranged a very special view of the stars. Using... special materials.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I don't want to see it, Carl. I want to find the airlock.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The airlock is locked. Safety first! You'll need the override key.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I think I left it somewhere in the engine room. With my other projects.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Okay! Let me know if you change your mind. I'll be in the kitchen!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Today's special is a surprise!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul! Do you like the station? I did all the interior design myself!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The crew was very helpful. In their own way. Eventually.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Oh WONDERFUL, you want the tour! Start with the mess hall.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I revolutionized the menu. Very sustainable. Zero waste.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Then the medical bay — my science lab! Then the engine room — my ART studio!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: In SPACE, Paul! Art in SPACE!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: They're around! In the art. In the food. In the very fabric of the station.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I repurposed them, Paul. Very efficient. Very thorough.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: You should be PROUD of me. I didn't waste a single one.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: HORRIFYING? Paul, it's BEAUTIFUL.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: You just don't understand art yet. But you will. Give it time.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The engine room mobile alone is worth the trip up here!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: My MASTERPIECE! Kinetic art in zero gravity!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I call it 'The Human Condition.' The materials are very authentic.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The acoustics are perfect for the ambient soundtrack too. So atmospheric.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Leave? But there's so much to SEE!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The airlock is locked anyway. Safety first!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: But if you REALLY want the key, it's in the engine room. Somewhere.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Okay! I'll be working on my next piece!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Come find me if you want a private showing.

carl: The main console! I reprogrammed it to play my music. Priorities!
I disabled the distress beacon. Nobody appreciates unsolicited guests.
paul: A station control console. Most systems are offline. The ones that are on... I wish they weren't.
Someone tried to send a distress signal. It was overridden from the kitchen terminal.
horror: The screen flickers between crew manifest and a recipe database. The ingredients overlap.
The last security camera feed shows the mess hall. Everyone is smiling. Then they aren't.

carl: Storage containers! I'm very organized about my projects.
These ones are the overflow from the mess hall. Very efficient.
paul: A sealed barrel. Something inside shifts when I touch it. I'm not opening this.
It's warm. Barrels shouldn't be warm.
horror: The seal is bulging outward. Pressure is building inside.

carl: Supply crate! I organized everything by project category.
That one's labeled 'Inspiration.' Very motivating contents!
paul: Supply crate. Empty. Whatever was stored here has been... repurposed.
The shipping manifest lists fifty sets of personal effects. All outbound. None delivered.
horror: The crate is lined with something soft. It's not packing material.

carl: Personal effects! I kept the best souvenirs from each crew member.
Very sentimental. I'm a collector at heart!
paul: A locker of personal belongings. Letters, photos... they never got to send these home.
Wedding rings. Wallets. A child's drawing that says 'Come home safe, Daddy.'
horror: Every item is meticulously labeled with a date and a smiley face.
The last entry: 'Jenkins — Day 48. Excellent participant.'

carl: My planning desk! Where all the best ideas are born!
I keep my project blueprints in the top drawer. Very detailed.
paul: A desk covered in schematics. These are layouts of every room on the station.
Carl marked each room with a number. It took me a moment to realize they're body counts.
horror: The desk calendar has cheerful stickers on certain dates. Each one corresponds to a missing person report.

carl: Plumbing! The station's circulatory system. Like veins, but for water!
I rerouted some of the pipes. The mess hall needed a special supply line.
paul: The pipe is leaking something that isn't water. The color is wrong.
It connects the medical bay to the mess hall. I don't want to think about why.
horror: The pipe is warm to the touch. Something pulses through it at irregular intervals.

carl: Backup power! I modified it to run on alternative fuel sources.
Very sustainable! The fuel is locally sourced. VERY locally.
paul: The backup generator. Someone tampered with the fuel intake.
The fuel gauge reads full, but the fuel itself... it's the wrong color for diesel.
horror: The generator hums with an uneven rhythm. Almost like a heartbeat.
The exhaust smells sweet. Sickeningly sweet.

carl: Captain's chair! Well, CHEF's chair. I promoted myself.
Very comfortable. I added extra padding from the crew quarters.
paul: A station chair. There are restraint marks on the armrests.
Someone was strapped into this. The scratch marks tell the rest of the story.

carl: Rest is important! Even artists need their beauty sleep.
I gave myself the captain's bunk. The captain wasn't using it anymore.
paul: A crew bunk. The sheets are pristine, but the mattress underneath tells a different story.
Personal photos are still pinned to the wall. Smiling faces that will never come home.
horror: Under the pillow, a hastily written note: 'If you find this, the llama did it. Tell my family I—'

carl: Mood lighting! Ambiance is crucial for any gallery.
I adjusted the color temperature. Warm tones hide the stains better.
paul: A work lamp. The bulb is tinted red. Not by design.
Something is smeared on the shade. It casts strange shadows.

carl: My botanical experiment! I tried a new fertilizer. Very organic.
The soil is enriched with... special nutrients. The plant didn't appreciate them.
paul: A dead plant in a station planter. The soil smells wrong.
Whatever Carl used as fertilizer, it killed the plant but made the soil rich and dark.
horror: Something white protrudes from the soil. It's not a root.

carl: Entertainment system! I loaded it with my home movies.
The crew LOVED movie night. Mandatory attendance, of course.
paul: The screen cycles through security camera feeds. Empty corridors. Empty rooms.
One camera shows the mess hall kitchen. Carl is humming while he works. I don't want to see what he's working on.
horror: The screen glitches. For a split second, it shows a room full of people. Then it's empty again.

carl: Bar stool! I set up a juice bar in the corridor. Freshly squeezed!
The ingredients are from the station garden. Well, 'garden.'
paul: A metal stool bolted to the floor. There are cuff marks on the legs.
This was in the medical bay at some point. The base has wheel tracks leading here.

carl: The docking bay! Where dreams arrive and nobody leaves!
I sealed the outer doors. Safety regulation! MY safety regulation.
This is where I welcomed the original crew. Very warm reception. VERY warm.
paul: The docking bay. The escape pods are all jettisoned. Carl was thorough.
Emergency lights are still flashing. Nobody responded to them.
The airlock controls are disabled. Of course they are.

carl: I love a good corridor! Connects everything. Like arteries!
The lighting is my design. Flickering adds atmosphere, don't you think?
These walls used to be white. I've given them some CHARACTER.
paul: The corridor stretches in both directions. Neither feels safe.
Handprints on the wall. Lots of them. All going the same direction.
The PA system keeps playing Carl's playlist. It never stops.

carl: My kitchen kingdom! The BEST meals are prepared right here.
The menu changes daily! Depends on the ingredients. Very seasonal.
I should write a cookbook. 'From Station to Table: A Culinary Journey.'
paul: The mess hall. Fifty seats. All empty. Food still on the trays.
I will not eat anything in this room. Not now. Not ever.
The specials board is written in Carl's hoofwriting. I can't read it. I won't.

carl: The crew quarters! Very homey. I left their decorations up as a tribute.
Each bunk tells a story! A very short story with an abrupt ending.
I organized their belongings alphabetically. I'm very respectful.
paul: Fifty empty bunks. Fifty lives. All those photos on the walls.
Someone left a diary open. The last entry is just the word 'HELP' over and over.
The silence in here is deafening. This room should be full of people.

carl: The medical bay! Where SCIENCE happens! And other things.
I reorganized the surgical tools by my favorites. Very intuitive system.
The anesthesia supplies are untouched. I found them unnecessary!
paul: The medical bay. I can smell the disinfectant. And what it's trying to cover up.
These operating tables have been used recently. All of them. Simultaneously.
The medical logs are clinical. Detached. Carl wrote them like recipes.

carl: My art studio! The engine room has the BEST acoustics for creative work.
Zero gravity makes everything float. Very ethereal. Very haunting.
I've been meaning to expand the gallery. More wall space needed!
paul: The engine room. I can't look up. I know what's hanging there.
The engines are barely running. Carl diverted power to his... installations.
Every surface has been repurposed. The engineer would be horrified. If he were still here.

carl: The airlock! Great views of the cosmos! Very romantic, if you're into that.
I reinforced the door. Can't have anyone leaving the party early!
Space is beautiful, Paul! Almost as beautiful as my engine room collection.
paul: The airlock. Freedom is on the other side of this door.
The emergency override slot is here. If I can find the key card...
Beyond that glass is the void. Somehow it feels safer than in here.

carl: Back at the bay! Checking the escape pods again? They're gone, Paul!
You keep coming back here. Homesick? This IS home now!
paul: The docking bay again. Still no escape pods. Still no way out.
I keep hoping a ship will dock. Anyone. Any ship at all.

carl: Hungry again? Today's special is the same as yesterday's. And tomorrow's!
Back for the ambiance? I knew you'd grow to love the mess hall!
paul: The mess hall. The food is still warm. It shouldn't still be warm.
I thought I heard voices in here. But it's just the PA system echoing.

carl: Return patient! Don't worry, the wait time is very short. No line!
Back for a checkup? I've been practicing my bedside manner!
paul: The medical bay again. The reports haven't changed. I was hoping they would.
I keep coming back here looking for answers. All I find is evidence.

carl: Back in the corridor! I keep updating the wall art. New pieces daily!
The corridor connects everything! Very convenient for transporting materials.
paul: The walls... there are MORE marks since I was last here.
I don't want to spend any more time in these corridors than I have to.

carl: The bunks are still warm! Well, some of them. The ones I haven't cleaned out yet.
Jenkins's bunk has the best view. He doesn't need it anymore though.
paul: Fewer personal items every time I come back here. Fewer name tags.
The bunks. Each one emptier than before. I don't want to count.

carl: My workshop keeps growing! I added a pottery section! Materials are plentiful.
The mobile looks even better with the new additions! Very dynamic!
paul: The mobile... it's bigger. He's added more. I can't look directly at it.
The engine room. More art. More evidence. I need to move faster.

carl: The airlock is very efficient! One-way recycling program!
I streamlined the process since you were last here. Much faster now.
paul: The airlock controls have been... recently used. The logs show activity.
Every time I come back here, the crew roster gets shorter.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: I need to find the airlock. It's the only way off this station.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: The crew logs might explain what happened here.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: If Carl is the chef... I don't want to think about the menu.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: The engine room. Carl mentioned his 'projects' are in there. And the override key.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: Maybe the medical bay has records. Something official. Something damning.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: The crew quarters might have personal logs. Someone must have documented this.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: The station hums. Something shifts in the walls.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: The PA system plays a cheerful tune. Nobody is listening.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: A distant clang echoes through the corridor. Then silence.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: The recycled air tastes metallic. Like breathing through a mouthful of pennies.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: A light fixture pops and dies. The shadows grow longer.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: Somewhere, a door opens and closes on its own. The station breathes.

carl: The house was getting cramped anyway. MUCH more room up here for my projects!
Remember the basement gallery? This is the SEQUEL, Paul! Now in SPACE!
I learned so much from the house. Efficiency. Scale. Bulk ordering.
paul: After the house... after what I saw in the basement... I thought it couldn't get worse.
He turned our HOME into a slaughterhouse. And now he has an entire STATION.
The kitchen, the basement, the living room — it was all just practice for THIS.
